title.narrative: Project document renewable energy in SE Liberia
Projektdokument förnybar energi i sydöstra Liberia

description.narrative: Det övergripande målet med det föreslagna programmet är att stimulera socioekonomisk utveckling och levnadsvillkoren för fattigdom i landsbygdsområden i Liberia genom att öka tillgången till el baserade på förnybara energikällor genom att engagera den privata sektorn att saminvestera i byggande, drift och expansion av eltjänster i distributionsnäten i sydöstra Liberia.

The overarching objective of the proposed programme is to stimulate socio-economic development and the living conditions of people living in poverty in rural areas of Liberia by increasing access to electricity based on renewable energy sources by engaging the private sector to co-invest in building, operating and expanding electricity services in the distribution networks in the South East of Liberia.
The programme will be complemented by two supporting measures, investing in access roads and in continued support to the reform process with the aim of ensuring an enabling regulatory environment. Ensuring physical access by road is expected to increase interest for participation from prospective electricity service providers as roads will lower the investment costs for building and maintaining renewable energy power plants and distribution grids compared to air-lifting equipment; and as roads also play a role in stimulating economic growth and poverty reduction, enabling goods and services to be brought to market and thereby also playing a key role in enabling growth in electricity demand, making the investments more viable. This is especially important in isolated grids where there are few options to sell surplus power outside the geographical boundaries of the mini-grid.
This assignment serves to procure a consultant to assist the Government of Liberia (Rural & Renewable Energy Agency (RREA)) to prepare a Programme Document in line with the Swedish development cooperation policies. The objective is to have a fully-fledged Programme Document incorporating the latest developments in the energy sector.

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The contribution was prepared and decided in old Trac. The embassy procured a consultant who assisted RREA (Rural Renewable Energy Agency) to prepare a Programme Document for increased access to renewable energy in south east Liberia. The PD focuses on involving the private sector to co-invest in the building, production and expansion of electricity services in the distribution networks in south east Liberia. The PD encompasses the latest development in the energy sector and has been developed in accordance with the Swedish development policies. In parallell the embassy procured another consultant who assisted the MPW (Ministry of Public Works) to prepare a Programme Document for access roads that intend to increase the interest of the private sector electricity service providers to participate in the market. It is believed that roads will lower the investment costs for building and maintaining renewable energy micro-utilities and distribution networks and will contribute to stimulate economic growth. Through a consultancy contract with Economic Consultancy Associates Limited, a comprehensive program document was developed. It highlights the overall objectives of the intervention as stimulating socio-economic development in south-east Liberia and improving the living conditions of rural populations. The program document also gives an overview of Liberia’s energy sector, a proposed implementation strategy, synopsis of energy related legislations, and renewable energy potential in Liberia.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
